more details:

Diwali Celebration
October 24th
11am-4pm

Diwali is the Festival of Lights. It is celebrated throughout India by
families and friends. Join us as we explore the sights, sounds and
spirit of this Indian holiday. Make a paper lantern, decorate a rangoli,
play games and more!

In the Common (2nd floor) 11:00am - 4:00pm

Diyas: make a traditional lamp for Diwali using recycled materials.
Rangoli: use colorful paper and natural materials to make a welcoming
design.
Paper Flowers: make a paper flower decoration to add to the festivities
Try on a Sari and see samples of Indian clothing.
Make a crown for Rama and Sita and learn why we celebrate Diwali.
Indian Spices: touch and smell some of the fragrant spices used in
Indian cooking.
Maduhubani Art: meet artist Sunanda Sahay and learn about this
traditional Indian folk art.
Diwali Aarti: join in and sing a special Hindu song for Diwali "Om Jai
Jagdish Hare" (only at 2:00pm!).

In PlaySpace (2nd floor) 11:00am - 4:00pm
Sensory Playdough: play with a special dough scented with Indian spices
like cinnamon, cumin, and cardamom.

In Countdown to Kindergarten (2nd floor) 11:30am & 12:30pm
Storytelling: Hear the story of Rama and Sita, one of many legends about
why Diwali is celebrated.
